column1: #Text=Polycrystalline sample of NaVOAsO4 was synthesized by the conventional solid-state reaction technique by annealing the stoichiometric mixture of Na2O (99.99%), As2O5 (99.99%), and VO2 (99.99%) (all from SigmaAldrich) in an evacuated silica tube at 500 ◦C for 48 h with one intermediate grinding and pelletization.
#Text=To avoid the hydration, the reactants were handled in an Ar filled glove box.
#Text=The resulting sample was green in color.
#Text=Its phase purity was confirmed by powder x-ray diffraction (XRD, PANalytical powder diffractometer with Cu Kα radiation, λave = 1.54182 ˚A) at room temperature.
#Text=Temperature (T) dependent powder XRD measurements were performed in the T-range 15 K - 300 K using the low-T attachment (Oxford Phenix) to the x-ray diffractometer.
#Text=Rietveld refinement of the observed XRD patterns was performed using the FullProf package [31], taking the initial parameters from Ref. 30.
